name: Yperia Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at Yperia for close to two weeks this summer we´ve got nothing but good things to say about the place. The rooms are spotlessly clean and modern. Our only small complaint are the beds that are somewhat small if you´re a tall person. We used the pool almost every day, a great spot for reading after a day at one of the beaches. The location is great in the centre of Aegali, which we also found was our favourite village of the island. There's a number of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel, ask Antonis for advice. We had our best evening at a cliff top restaurant in the tiny village just next to Aegilai, the view was amazing.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: If you´re looking for a small, relaxed and personal hotel in a village far away from the large commercial resorts, this is it. A big thank you to Antonis, his wife and their family and staff for a lovely stay!
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: The first time we stayed at the first taverna in the Chora, much as you stepped off the old rickety bus which took you from the port Katapoula.. This time we luxuriated in the lovely Yperia Hotel. With its super swimming pool, lovely views and excellent hospitality. It is difficult to find fault as it is so well run and immaculately clean and offers special value in its position overlooking Aegiali.
reviews.title: Perfect gem on Amorgos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to be honest Aegiali is a bit limited though very pretty surrounded by mountain scenery. Probably has only two better than average restaurants, one of which is always packed out though it also has a lot of pretty average ones.Even by Greek island standards it has a bit to learn and though the sandy beach is long, it has no facilities other than tree shade. This is a big downside, as Amorgos is hardly blessed with sandy beaches and amazingly, the very best one, is on the eastern tip of the island well beyond maybe 15-20 kms drive from Katapoula. Most visitors seem to choose Aghia Anna in the shade of the amazing monastry. The beach referred to above (not Aghia Anna) is at the very end of the map and most wont ever find it , with its small rickety Kantina, dusty beach umbrellas, very sandy beach and delicious harbour protected bathing with stunning scenery. Well worth the effort.
reviews.title: Excellent in any way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Antonis offers you a very good value hotel and his two elderly retainers are totally charming and cook a great breakfast which can be served sitting round the pool. The hotel is right over the port.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hired a car for 3 of our 4 days and spent a lot of time in Katapoula where the selection of restaurants is afr more impressive, especially if you trek down and round the town beach where just beyond the Big Blue Bar are two harbour side restaurants of exceptional standard and imaginative food - Greek dishes with a twist. Katapoula is three times the size it was when we last visited, but all the better for it. The Chora itself, remains, I believe, the best in the whole of the Greek islands with its delightful twisting lanes and multiple churches and amazing views. Truly magnificent.
reviews.title: Nice and Friendly

description: The Yperia Hotel has at its disposal large rooms with a fantastic view over the Aegean Sea and the port of Aegiali. The architecture of the building is inspired by the traditional Amorgian character of the ancient housing estates of the island. All the rooms are decorated with traditional hand made furniture and iron beds, which gives a unique feeling of elegance and comfort to the guests.
